name: Authentic Thai Green Curry
author: Toi
summary: This is a classic Thai green curry (kaeng kiau wan) and my favorite curry of all time! You can substitute chicken or tofu for the pork, but make sure you serve it with lots of jasmine rice.
ingredients: 2 (8 ounce) cans bamboo shoots, drained and thinly sliced
3 tablespoons green curry paste, or more to taste
1 pound lean boneless pork, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
1 small red bell pepper, thinly sliced
2 teaspoons fish sauce, or more to taste
directions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil and cook bamboo shoots for 5 minutes
Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat and cook curry paste until fragrant, about 2 minutes
Add pork, increase heat and cook until starting to brown, 3 to 5 minutes
Add bamboo shoots, coconut milk, and red bell pepper
Reduce heat and bring to a simmer
Season with sugar and salt; simmer for 10 minutes
Stir in Thai basil and serve
